Max Control

An interactive music event

  • C++
  • Arduino
  • MaxMSP

Max Control was an event created by myself and four others that showcased a number of instruments and an LED based, reactive lighting system. Over the course of several months, each member of the group developed their own systems and together, we rehearsed a performance that would demonstrate how each of these could be utilised.

For my system, I created reactive LED lighting to give the event some interesting visual content. This was acheived by sending amplitude data from MaxMSP, through serial port connection into an Arduino. A program written for the Arduino then took the incoming data and used it as an indication of how many lights on each LED strip should be displayed.
